query: Does the Commission expressly undertake not to table a fresh proposal for the introduction at European level of body scanners at least until investigations have been completed regarding their implications in terms of health, cost and respect for individual privacy, (a) investigations have been completed regarding their implications in terms of health, cost and respect for individual privacy, (b) the technology has been judged indispensable, proportional and effective and (c) prior consultations have been carried out with the EDPS under the provisions of Article 28(2) of Regulation EC No 45/2001 OJ L 8, 12.1.2001, p. 1. of the European Parliament and of the Council of 18 December 2000 and (d) the European Parliament has been informed?
